Description: A spherical marble of grey crystalline limestone, bearing the incised serekh of Anedjib. Used in the game mḥn.
Curator's comments: For similar inscribed marbles, see P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit’, supplement, (Wiesbaden, 1964), 28-30 and abb. 1050 C, 1051-2; P. Kaplony, 'Mitteilungen der Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts Abteilung Kairo' 20 (Wiesbaden, 1965), 6-7; P. Kaplony ‘Beschriftete Kleinfunde in der Sammlung Georges Michailidis Ergebnisse einer Bestandsaufnahme im Sommer 1968’ (Istanbul, 1973), nos. 5-20 (the antiquity of some of the inscriptions on these objects is doubtful). For uninscribed marbles, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Gizeh and Rifeh' (Warminster, 1977, pl.IV; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tombs of the courtiers and Oxyrhynkos' (London, 1925), pl.VII, 6; T. E. Peet in E. Naville (ed.), ‘The cemeteries of Abydos’ II (London, 1913), pl.X, 3; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' II' (London, 1954), 56-9 and pl.XXIX, 233F; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), 84, nos. 37-8; Compare Z. Y. Saad, 'The excavations at Helwan art and civilization in the first and second Egyptian dynasties' (Norman, 1969) pl.XXXVIa; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ II (Berlin, 1929-31), nos. 275-6 and pl.33. Bibliography: P. Kaplony, 'Mitteilungen der Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts Abteilung Kairo' 20 (Wiesbaden, 1965), 6.
